> He goes looking for Talos.
>

{Talos}
Mess Hall

    Things were looking better in the mess hall, the salvagable chairs and
tables were upright and the bar unit and energon stores were alright for the
moment, but they'd need to begin searching for reserves soon. By now the
reports of the communications repairs had filtered in as well as reports of
the sensor enhancment to the north.

    Looking around he nodded to those present and made his way back to the
bridge. The first day of the new beast wars had gone smoothly with only a
few minor problems left to deal with. First were the two younger bots on
board, he had no idea how they got there, this wasn't a passenger ship but
the fact of the matter they were here and that meant they had to be included
in the mission.

    As he walked onto the bridge nodding to Sunhawk since he seemed to be
looking for him he took his chair and turned to regard the leutenient even
as he played over the second issue in his thoughts, Sunhawk was a wanted
felon. He knew it and Sunhawk knew it. However he was willing to give any
bot, no matter the tarnish on his or her record, an opportunity to prove
themselves. He held no doubts that Sunhawk would be taken into custody by
the port officials when the mission was done with, but depending on how the
bot held himself during this mission would decide wether or not he'd have
Talos' good word put in for him.

    Turning he noticed one of the consoles blinking, turning distracted from
his thoughts and Sunhawks report as he investigated. A weak signal was being
caught by the new arrays dish. It seemed like an outdated distress beacon
signal and maximal in design, but this algorithim hadn't been used
since...the original beast wars.

    Talos rose shaking his head, impossible. There's no way one of Primals
crew could still be here could there? He couldn't chance it. Pressing a
button on the comm he spoke, "Hot Rod, Blackknight, report to the bridge for
new orders." Sitting back in his chair he turned back to regard Sunhawk.
